Umineko Project (UP): Knock‐knock‐knock‐knock!!!
Steam (ST): *knock*knock*knock*knock*!!!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=ST]

Russian (RU): Тук‐тук‐тук‐тук!!!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Bam‐bam‐bam‐bam!!!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 咚咚咚咚！！！
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): The sudden sound of someone banging fiercely on the door brought Natsuhi to her senses.
Steam (ST): The sudden sound of someone banging fiercely on the door brought Natsuhi to her senses.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 突然の激しく扉を打ち鳴らす音に、夏妃は意識を取り戻す。
Russian (RU): Нацухи привели в чувства неожиданные яростные стуки в дверь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O repentino som de alguém batendo vigorosamente contra a porta fez com que Natsuhi recuperasse seus sentidos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 突然響起的激烈敲門聲令夏妃取回了意識。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 突然响起的激烈敲门声令夏妃取回了意识。

Umineko Project (UP): She had probably nodded off in the study while planning how they would overcome the next day.
Steam (ST): She had probably nodded off in the study while planning how they would overcome the next day.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She had probably nodded off in the study while planning how they would overcome the next day.
PC Japanese (JP): 書斎で、明日をどう乗り越えるか思案している間に、つい、うつらうつらしてしまったのだろう。
Russian (RU): Вероятно, она задремала в кабинете, ища способ преодолеть завтрашний день.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela provavelmente acabou cochilando no estúdio enquanto pensava em como iria superar o dia seguinte.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在書房中思索著如何撐過明日的她，恐怕是想著想著就不由自主地昏昏欲睡、神智模糊了吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在书房中思索着如何撑过明日的她，恐怕是想着想着就不由自主地昏昏欲睡、神智模糊了吧。

Umineko Project (UP): But...what could it be...? At a time like this...
Steam (ST): But...what could it be...? At a time like this...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But...what could it be...? At a time like this...
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、何事…？このような時間に。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかし、何事…？　このような時間に。
Russian (RU): Но... кто бы это мог быть?.. Да ещё и в такое время...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas...quem poderia ser...? Em um momento como esse...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，是何事呢…？都這時間了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，是何事呢…？都这时间了。

Umineko Project (UP): More importantly, the knock itself was strange.
Steam (ST): More importantly, the knock itself was strange.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): More importantly, the knock itself was strange.
PC Japanese (JP): それよりも、ノックというのがおかしかった。
Russian (RU): Что более важно, странно уже то, что стучат.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mais importante que isso, a batida em si foi estranha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 比這更令人感到奇怪的，是敲門一事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 比这更令人感到奇怪的，是敲门一事。

Umineko Project (UP): If someone had wanted to contact her, they could have just used the internal phone line.
Steam (ST): If someone wanted to contact her, they could've just used the internal phone line.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If someone had tried to contact her, they could have just used the internal phone line.
PC Japanese (JP): 仮に何か連絡があるなら、内線電話を使えばいいだけの話だ。
Russian (RU): Если кто‐то хотел связаться с ней, можно было просто позвонить по внутренней линии.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se alguém quisesse entrar em contato com ela, poderia simplesmente ter usado a linha interna.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 假如是有什麼事要聯絡，那就只需打個內線電話就行了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 假如是有什么事要联络，那就只需打个内线电话就行了。

Umineko Project (UP): She had told them that she would be here.
Steam (ST): She'd told them that she'd be here.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She had told them that she would be here.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela já havia dito a todos que estaria ali.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 明明說過，我會待在這裡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 明明说过，我会待在这里。

Umineko Project (UP): Realizing that something strange was going on, Natsuhi shook her head one more time, completely throwing off her drowsiness.
Steam (ST): Realizing that something strange was going on, Natsuhi shook her head one more time, completely throwing off her drowsiness.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Realizing that something strange was going on, Natsuhi shook her head one more time, completely throwing off her drowsiness.
PC Japanese (JP): 何かおかしな事態が起こりつつあることを気取り、夏妃はもう一度頭を振って、眠気を完全に振り払った。
Russian (RU): Понимая, что происходит нечто странное, Нацухи ещё раз тряхнула головой, окончательно отбросив сонливость.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Percebendo que algo estranho estava acontecendo, Natsuhi sacudiu sua cabeça novamente, dispersando toda sua sonolência.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 意識到了什麼異常事態正在發生，夏妃又一次搖了搖頭，徹底地趕跑了睡意。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 意识到了什么异常事态正在发生，夏妃又一次摇了摇头，彻底地赶跑了睡意。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Pai, pai...!! É a Eva. Tenho algo urgente e vital para falar com você!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「爸、爸…！！我是绘羽。十万火急，我有要事要向您汇报！」

Steam (ST): Natsuhi ran up to the door, responded with a small knock, and spoke through the door in a quiet voice.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Natsuhi correu até a porta, respondeu com uma leve batida, e falou através da porta com um tom de voz ameno.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva

Steam (ST): "Natsuhi nee-san...?! Why are you in Father's study at this hour?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Natsuhi nee-san...?! Why are you in Father's study at this hour?!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Umineko Project (UP): "......I told you to be quiet! Have you forgotten that the head treasures peace and silence above all else...?!"
Steam (ST): "...I told you to be quiet! Have you forgotten that the Head values peace and silence more than anything else...?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......I told you to be quiet! Have you forgotten that the head likes peace and silence more than anything else...?!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……我在叫你安静！难道你忘了，当主大人最喜好沉默与寂静…？！」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「现在可不是说这种话的时候哟！！别废话了，快点开门吧！！叫爸出来！！」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Umineko Project (UP): "The head just went to sleep! I don't know what business you have, but I will listen to it tomorrow!"
Steam (ST): "The Head just went to sleep! I don't know what business you have, but I will deal with it tomorrow!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva

Steam (ST): "I don't have any business with you!! Just open up right now!!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「又不是要找你！！好了好了，你就快把门开了吧！！」

Umineko Project (UP): Sometimes, all one's schemes and assumptions can fall apart due to the most direct, simple, and emotional of strategies.
Steam (ST): Sometimes, multiple schemes and assumptions can fall apart due to the most direct, simple, and emotional of strategies.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Sometimes, multiple schemes and hypotheses can fall apart due to the most direct, simple, and emotional of strategies.
PC Japanese (JP): 時に、数々の知略や想定は、もっとも愚直で単純で感情的な一手に翻弄されることがある。
Russian (RU): Иногда множество схем и предположений могут развалиться из‐за самых прямых, простых и эмоциональных стратегий.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Às vezes, todos os esquemas e suposições de alguém, podem se despedaçar devido a mais direta, mais simples e emocional estratégia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 有時，準備良多的智謀與假設，反倒會被最為愚直、單純、衝動的一招所打亂。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 有时，准备良多的智谋与假设，反倒会被最为愚直、单纯、冲动的一招所打乱。

Umineko Project (UP): "...I, I understand. I will be there soon. Don't worry about Eva. Just stay there and don't do anything...! I'll give you a signal once I've gotten Eva away from the door, so leave as soon as you hear that. Be ready...!"

PC Japanese (JP): 「…わ、わかった。私もそこに行く。絵羽には構うな。何もせずそこにいるんだ…！　扉の前から絵羽を追い払ったら合図するから、すぐに出て来たまえ。いいな…！」

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Umineko Project (UP): "......To think he's still being called out to settle his children's fights even though he's been told he only has a short while to live. ......I wonder how he feels right about now. ......*giggle*. Imagining that...no, deducing that will be a treat."
Steam (ST): ...To think he's being called out to settle his children's fight, even though it's been announced that he has only a short while to live. ...I wonder how he feels right about now. *giggle* Imagining that...no, reasoning that out will be a treat."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......To think he's being called out to settle his children's fight even though it's been announced that he has only a short while to live. ......I wonder how he feels right about now. ......*giggle*. Imagining that...no, reasoning that out will be a treat."
PC Japanese (JP): ……子どもの喧嘩に、余命あとわずかと宣告されてる今になっても、まだ呼び出されるなんて。……どういう気持ちかしらね、金蔵さん。……くすくす。それを想像、…いえ、推理するのも乙なものです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……子どもの喧嘩に、余命あとわずかと宣告されてる今になっても、まだ呼び出されるなんて。……どういう気持ちかしらね、金蔵さん。……くすくす。それを想像、…いいえ、推理するのも乙なものです」
Russian (RU): "......Его зовут улаживать стычку его детей, а ведь было заявлено, что жить ему осталось всего‐ничего. ......Интересно, как он сейчас. ......*хи‐хи*. Предполагать...... хотя нет, рассуждать будет одно удовольствие."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......E pensar que começariam uma briga infantil dessas mesmo depois de ficarem sabendo que ele tem pouco tempo de vida. ......Me pergunto como ele se sente agora. ......*risos*. Imaginar isso...não, deduzir isso será um prazer."

Umineko Project (UP): The parents ignored Battler and Erika and kept yelling at each other, on and on...
Steam (ST): The parents ignored Battler and Erika...and kept yelling at each other, on and on...

PC Japanese (JP): 親たちは、戦人たちのことなど忘れ、延々と怒鳴り合いを続けている…。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os parentes ignoraram Battler e Erika e continuaram gritando uns com os outros...

Umineko Project (UP): Even though Battler had more or less imagined that this sort of thing happened behind the scenes, this was the first time he had seen it.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though Battler had more or less imagined that this sort of thing happened behind the scenes, this was the first time he had seen it.
PC Japanese (JP): 戦人にとって、……その光景は薄々想像がついていながらも、初めて目にするものだった。
Russian (RU): Хотя Баттлер более‐менее представлял, как за кулисами происходит нечто подобное, видел он это впервые.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo Battler tendo mais ou menos imaginado que esse tipo de coisa acontecia nos bastidores, ele nunca havia presenciado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對戰人來說，……雖然這種情景他也是有稍稍地想像到的，但親眼目睹還是第一次。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对战人来说，……虽然这种情景他也是有稍稍地想象到的，但亲眼目睹还是第一次。

Umineko Project (UP): He had suspected it since six years ago, and he'd been able to get a pretty good idea of what this was like by the darkening expressions on his parents' faces when this time of year drew near...
Steam (ST): He'd suspected it since six years ago, and he'd been able to get a pretty good idea of what this was like by the darkening expressions on his parents' faces when this time of year drew near...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He had suspected it since six years ago, and he'd been able to get a pretty good idea of what this was like by the darkening expressions on his parents' faces when this time of year drew near...
PC Japanese (JP): ６年前から勘付いていたし、この時期が近付くと暗くなる両親の表情からも、何となく想像はついていた…。
Russian (RU): Он заподозрил ещё шесть лет назад и хорошо представлял себе, что там творится, видя лица родителей, которые с приближением этого месяца становились всё мрачнее...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele suspeitava disso desde seis anos atrás, e foi capaz de ter uma boa ideia de como ficavam as expressões sombrias de seus parentes quando essa época do ano se aproximava...

Umineko Project (UP): However, this argument his relatives were having before his very eyes......was much more......ugly than he had imagined...
Steam (ST): However, this argument his relatives were having before his very eyes... ...was much more... ...ugly than he'd imagined...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, this argument his relatives were having before his very eyes......was much more......ugly than he had imagined...
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、目の当たりにする親族たちの罵り合いは、……想像を超えてあまりに、……醜いものだった…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかし、目の当たりにする親族たちの罵り合いは、……想像を超えてあまりに、……醜いものだった…。

Umineko Project (UP): He was very glad that he'd called the adults out here without letting the cousins catch wind of anything......

Original Witch Hunt (OG): That's why he was very glad that he'd called the adults out here without letting the cousins catch wind of anything......

Steam (ST): They thought of the possibility that someone might snatch the gold away while their backs were turned, but of course, no one could manage much with just human hands and a small amount of time when it's 10 tons of gold they're dealing with.

PC Japanese (JP): 目を離している間に、黄金を誰かが持ち去るのでは、とも考えたが、１０ｔもの黄金を、人間の手でわずかの時間にどうにか出来るわけがない。
Russian (RU): Они не исключали, что кто‐нибудь может украсть золото за их спинами, но, конечно же, никто не смог бы справиться с 10 тоннами обычными человеческими руками и за такое короткое время.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eles pensaram na possibilidade de alguém tentar carregar o ouro para fora quando eles dessem as costas, mas não era como se alguém conseguisse fazer muito com mãos humanas e tão pouco tempo, estando diante de dez toneladas de ouro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然也有想過，在沒人盯著的時候，搞不好會有誰來拿走黃金，不過，10 吨的黃金，以人類之手，一小會兒時間內，是怎麼都不可能有辦法搬走的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然也有想过，在没人盯着的时候，搞不好会有谁来拿走黄金，不过，10 吨的黄金，以人类之手，一小会儿时间内，是怎么都不可能有办法搬走的。

Umineko Project (UP): In fact, it even seemed as though having this mountain of gold in the background was robbing them of the ability to make sound decisions.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 令他們擔心的反而是，金山這種異常光景，是否甚至會從他們那奪走冷靜的判斷。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): So they agreed to return to the mansion, in part so that they could regain their composure and continue the conference more ruthlessly......

Steam (ST): "Sure, sorry. Did we bother you too much?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Sure, sorry. Did we bother you too much?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Umineko Project (UP): "Please let us show our gratitude again tomorrow. Sorry for letting you see such an embarrassing side of us."
Steam (ST): "Let us show our gratitude again tomorrow. Sorry for letting you see such an embarrassing side of us."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Let us show our gratitude again tomorrow. Sorry for letting you see such an embarrassing side of us."

Russian (RU): "Позволь нам завтра ещё раз отблагодарить тебя. Извини, что выставили себя перед тобой в неловком свете."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Umineko Project (UP): "I know you said you were turning it down, but we'll still prepare a fitting share, out of gratitude, for you as one of the first to discover the gold. Right, Nii‐san?"
Steam (ST): "You said that you refused, but allow us to prepare a fitting portion, out of gratitude, for you as one of the first to discover the gold. Right, Nii-san?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "You said that you refused, but allow us to prepare a fitting portion, out of gratitude, for you as one of the first to discover the gold. Right, Nii-san?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「あなたは辞退すると言ったけど、私たちはあなたへの感謝の気持ちを込めて、第一発見者の一人に相応しい分け前を用意させていただくわ。ねぇ、兄さん？」
Russian (RU): "Ты сказала, что отказалась, но разреши нам из благодарности приготовить тебе достойную долю, как одной из первых, кто обнаружил золото. Верно, брат?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sei que disse que estava abrindo mão, mas continuamos dispostos a dividir igualmente, como gratidão por ter sido uma das primeiras a encontrar o ouro. Certo, nii‐san?"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「虽然你说过不要，但我们还是会满怀对你的感激之情，准备好与第一发现人之一的身份相应的那一份的。是吧，哥？」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu virei o tabuleiro diversas vezes tentando explorar os movimentos da Beato.{n}Essa é sempre a primeira coisa que acabo tropeçando.

Umineko Project (UP): The significance of the epitaph murders.
Steam (ST): The significance of the epitaph murders.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The significance of the epitaph murders.

Steam (ST): Why did she have to commit serial murders in a way that reproduced the witch's epitaph?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Why did she have to commit serial murders in a way that reproduced the witch's epitaph?
PC Japanese (JP): なぜ、魔女の碑文を再現するように連続殺人を犯さなければならないのか。
Russian (RU): Почему Беато совершала серийные убийства, следуя методу, представленному в эпитафии ведьмы?

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 為什麼非得要如重現魔女的碑文般地犯下連續殺人？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 为什么非得要如重现魔女的碑文般地犯下连续杀人？

Umineko Project (UP): If she wanted to kill the whole Ushiromiya family for revenge, it would be much simpler, safer, and more reliable if she just put poison into their dinner, or else went around killing people one by one in the middle of the night while they were sleeping.
Steam (ST): If she wanted to kill the whole Ushiromiya family for revenge, it'd be much simpler, safer, and more reliable if she just put poison into their dinner... or else went around killing people one by one in the middle of the night while they were sleeping.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If she wanted to kill the whole Ushiromiya family for revenge, it would be much simpler, safer, and more reliable if she just put poison into their dinner or else went around killing people one by one in the middle of the night while they were sleeping.
PC Japanese (JP): 右代宮家を復讐のために皆殺しにする、というなら、晩餐の料理に毒でも盛るか、寝静まった深夜にひとりずつ殺して回る方が、よっぽど簡単で安全、確実だ。
Russian (RU): Если она хотела убить всю семью Уширомия ради мести, было бы гораздо проще, безопаснее и надёжнее просто подсыпать яд в ужин, или же убить всех по одному среди ночи, пока они спят.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se ela queria matar toda a família Ushiromiya por vingança, seria muito mais simples, seguro e realista se ela simplesmente tivesse colocado veneno na comida ou ter saído matando um por um durante a noite, enquanto todos dormiam.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如果是為了向右代宮家復仇而要殺光所有人的話，那在晚餐的料理中下毒，或在大家入睡後寧靜的深夜，一個接一個地殺死的方法，要更加更加的簡單、安全、可靠。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如果是为了向右代宫家复仇而要杀光所有人的话，那在晚餐的料理中下毒，或在大家入睡后宁静的深夜，一个接一个地杀死的方法，要更加更加的简单、安全、可靠。

Umineko Project (UP): However, on the first evening, Beato sends us a letter that sounds like an advance notice, and then carries out what could be broadly described as a three‐part serial murder, killing six people on the first twilight, two on the second, and five on the fourth and later.
Steam (ST): However, on the first evening, Beato sent us a letter that sounded like an advance notice... and then carried out a three-part serial murder with large gaps in between: the six people of the first twilight, the two people of the second twilight, and the five people of the fourth and later twilights.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, on the first evening, Beato sent us a letter that sounded like an advance notice and then carried out a three part serial murder with large gaps in between the six people of the first twilight, the two people of the second twilight, and the five people of the fourth and later twilights.
PC Japanese (JP): しかしベアトは、最初の晩に予告状めいた手紙を送りつけ、第一の晩に６人、第二の晩に２人、第四の晩以降に５人と、大きく分けて三度の連続殺人を行なう。
Russian (RU): Однако в первый вечер Беато отправляет нам письмо, похожее на уведомление, а затем совершает состоящее из трёх частей серийное убийство с большими промежутками между ними: шесть человек на первые сумерки, два человека на вторые сумерки и пять на четвёртые и последующие.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas, na primeira noite, a Beato nos mandou uma nota que parecia mais um aviso prévio, e conduziu o que poderia ser amplamente descrito como um assassinato em série em três atos, matando seis pessoas no primeiro crepúsculo, duas no segundo, e mais cinco, do quarto até o final.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而，貝阿朵卻在第一天晚上送來了帶有一點事前預告的意思的信，在第一晚 6 人，在第二晚 2 人，從第四晚起的 5 人，實行了可大致分為三次的連續殺人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，贝阿朵却在第一天晚上送来了带有一点事前预告的意思的信，在第一晚 6 人，在第二晚 2 人，从第四晚起的 5 人，实行了可大致分为三次的连续杀人。

Umineko Project (UP): We aren't fools.
Steam (ST): We aren't fools.

Steam (ST): Once the first murders occur, we barricade ourselves in somewhere to stave off any further murders.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Once the first murders occur, we barricade ourselves in somewhere to stave off any further murders.

Russian (RU): После первых убийств мы запираемся где‐нибудь, чтобы предотвратить дальнейшие убийства.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim que os primeiros assassinatos ocorreram, nós nos barricamos em algum lugar para impedir que houvessem novos assassinatos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在發生第一起凶殺時起，我們就會開始籠城，遏制下起凶殺的發生。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在发生第一起凶杀时起，我们就会开始笼城，遏制下起凶杀的发生。

Umineko Project (UP): Furthermore, we quickly suspect a culprit among us and start analyzing each other's alibis.
Steam (ST): Furthermore, we quickly suspect a culprit among us and start analyzing each other's alibis.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Furthermore, we quickly suspect a culprit among us and start analyzing each other's alibis.

Russian (RU): Кроме того, мы начинаем искать преступника среди нас и анализируем алиби друг друга.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Além disso, nós rapidamente suspeitamos que o culpado poderia estar entre nós, e começamos a analisar os álibis uns dos outros.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，我們還會早早地開始懷疑內部犯案，互相查證彼此的不在場證明。

Umineko Project (UP): As the victims increase, the number of suspects decreases automatically, and Beato's chances of completing the serial murder drop closer and closer to zero...
Steam (ST): As the victims increase, the number of suspects decreases automatically, and Beato's chances of success in this serial murder drop closer and closer to zero...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As the victims increase, the number of suspects decreases automatically, and Beato's chances of success in this serial murder drop closer and closer to zero...

Russian (RU): С увеличением жертв число подозреваемых автоматически снижается, и шансы Беато на успех в этом серийном убийстве падают всё ближе и ближе к нулю...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O número de vítimas aumentou, e o número de suspeitos automaticamente diminuiu, e as chances da Beato de completar seu assassinato em série diminuiu cada vez mais até próximo do zero...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 越是出現更多的犧牲者，就越是自動地減少嫌疑犯的人數，貝阿朵完成連續殺人的成功率，朝零逼近…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 越是出现更多的牺牲者，就越是自动地减少嫌疑犯的人数，贝阿朵完成连续杀人的成功率，朝零逼近…。

Russian (RU): Все эти убийства эпитафии...... Она как будто душит свою же шею, всё больше усложняя задачу преуспеть в серийном убийстве. ......Всё ради бесполезных украшений...... только для вида.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Tudo que envolveu os assassinatos de epitáfio......prescindivelmente ornamentado e desguarnecidamente decorado......o que só fez parecer ainda mais complicado para ela conduzir o assassinato em série.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 碑文杀人全部都是，……在完成连续杀人的意义上，充满了犹如掐紧了自己脖子的，……无用的装饰，……与虚饰。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "Did you know? In mystery novels, there are sometimes murders that follow the events of a poem or nursery rhyme, just like these epitaph murders. ......I think you can split the reasons these "nursery‐rhyme murders" occur into three major groups."
Steam (ST): "Did you know? In mystery novels, they call things like these epitaph murders "plotline murders". ...I think you can split the possible motives for plotline murders like this into three groups."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Did you know? In mystery novels, they call things like these epitaph murders 'plotline murders'. ......I think you can split the possible reasons for these plotline murders into three groups."
PC Japanese (JP): 「知ってるか？　ミステリー小説では、こういう碑文殺人のことを“見立て殺人”という。……この見立て殺人が行なわれる理由を、俺は３つに大別できると思ってる。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「知ってるか？　ミステリー小説では、こういう碑文殺人のことを“見立て殺人”という。……この見立て殺人が行なわれる理由を、俺は３つに大別できると思ってる」
Russian (RU): "Ты знала? В детективных романах такие вещи, как убийства эпитафии, называют 'убийствами по сценарию'. ......Я думаю, что возможные причины таких убийств можно разделить на три группы."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você sabia? Em romances policiais, é comum que assassinatos ocorram seguindo os acontecimentos de um poema ou uma cantiga de roda, assim como esses assassinatos de epitáfio. ......Acredito que você possa dividir o motivo desses "assassinatos de cantiga" ocorridos em três grupos principais."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「知道嗎？在推理小說中，類似這碑文殺人的事件被稱為“比擬殺人”。……而實行比擬殺人的理由，我覺得可以大致分為 3 類。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「知道吗？在推理小说中，类似这碑文杀人的事件被称为“比拟杀人”。……而实行比拟杀人的理由，我觉得可以大致分为 3 类。」

Speaker: {f:5:Virgilia}
Umineko Project (UP): "......And what are those?"
Steam (ST): "...And what are those?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……うかがいましょう。」
Russian (RU): "......И какие же?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......E quais seriam?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "The first would be when it benefits the culprit to follow the epitaph and thereby confuse the evidence and alibis. ......The classic technique of pretending to be dead and mixing yourself in with the victims is an example of this, as is committing murders in an order that doesn't follow the epitaph so that you can cause the others to mistake the order and give yourself an alibi."
Steam (ST): "Well, first off, maybe following the epitaph gives rise to misconceptions about evidence and alibis, which might benefit the culprit. ...Pretending to be dead and mixing yourself in with the victims would fit this pattern, as would committing murders that don't actually follow the epitaph, giving yourself an alibi by getting people to incorrectly guess the order of events."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "The first would be the benefit the culprit receives by following the epitaph and thereby confusing the evidence and alibis. ......Pretending to be dead and mixing yourself in with the victims fits this pattern, as does committing murders that don't follow the epitaph and making the others get the order wrong, so that you can give yourself an alibi."
PC Japanese (JP): 「１つは、碑文に沿うことで、証拠やアリバイを誤魔化し、犯人に利するためだ。……死んだふりをして、自らを犠牲者に混ぜる古典もこれだし、碑文に沿わずに殺人を犯し、その発生順序を誤解させることによって、アリバイを作るのもこれだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「１つは、碑文に沿うことで、証拠やアリバイを誤魔化し、犯人に利するためだ。……死んだふりをして、自らを犠牲者に交ぜる古典もこれだし、碑文に沿わずに殺人を犯し、その発生順序を誤解させることによって、アリバイを作るのもこれだ」
Russian (RU): "Первая: следуя эпитафии, преступник запутывает в свою пользу улики и алиби. ......В такой сценарий укладывается притвориться мёртвым и смешаться с жертвами... А также совершить убийства, не входящие в эпитафию, и заставить других неправильно понять, чтобы можно было сделать себе алиби."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O primeiro seria quando é benéfico para o culpado seguir o epitáfio e assim confundir as evidências e álibis. ......A clássica técnica de forjar a própria morte e se misturar em meio às vítimas é um grande exemplo, conforme comete os assassinatos em uma ordem que não segue o epitáfio, para que assim você possa fazer com que os outros confundam a ordem e criem um álibi para você."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「一個是，通過模仿碑文下手，從而在證據與不在場證明上搞鬼，令犯人獲利。……裝死，將自己混入犧牲者中，就是屬於這種，不精確地依照碑文殺人，令人誤會凶殺的發生順序，製造不在場證明也屬於此類。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「一个是，通过模仿碑文下手，从而在证据与不在场证明上搞鬼，令犯人获利。……装死，将自己混入牺牲者中，就是属于这种，不精确地依照碑文杀人，令人误会凶杀的发生顺序，制造不在场证明也属于此类。」

Speaker: {f:5:Virgilia}
Umineko Project (UP): "I see. So she could make it look as though she was carrying out the murders in accordance with the epitaph, ......when she was actually guiding everyone's thinking in a manner that benefited her. That sounds interesting."
Steam (ST): "I see. So perhaps she only made it look as though she was killing them in a ceremonial fashion, following the epitaph, ...when she was actually guiding their thinking in a manner that benefited her. I do find that intriguing."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I see. So perhaps she only made it look as though she was killing them in a ceremony following the epitaph......when she was actually guiding their thinking in a manner that benefited her. That sounds interesting."
PC Japanese (JP): 「なるほど。碑文に沿って儀式的に殺していると見せかけて、……実は自分に利するように誘導しているわけですね。面白いと思います。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「なるほど。碑文に沿って儀式的に殺していると見せかけて、……実は自分に利するように誘導しているわけですね。面白いと思います」
Russian (RU): "Понятно. Поэтому она могла только притворяться, что убивает их по ритуалу эпитафии...... когда на самом деле наводила их на выгодные ей мысли. Звучит интересно."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Entendo. Então ela poderia fazer parecer que estava conduzindo os assassinatos de acordo com o epitáfio, ......quando, na verdade, ela estava guiando todos a pensar de forma que a beneficiasse. Isso parece bem interessante."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「原來如此。表面上像是在依照碑文，像是進行著儀式般地殺，……其實卻在牽線搭橋，令自己處於有利位置。這話挺有趣呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「原来如此。表面上像是在依照碑文，像是进行着仪式般地杀，……其实却在牵线搭桥，令自己处于有利位置。这话挺有趣呢。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): ".........However, in our games, the dead are truly down for the count thanks to the red. ...She might be able to trick everyone in the world of the game board, but she can't trick us up here in the same way. ......In other words, the most traditional purpose for this kind of murder...isn't what we're dealing with here."
Steam (ST): "......However, in our games, the dead are truly down for the count thanks to the red. ...While she might've confused people in the world of the game board, she can't confuse us up here like that. ...In other words, the most obvious possible goal for her...isn't the real one."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........However, in our games, the dead are truly down for the count thanks to the red. ...While she might have confused them in the world of the game board, she can't confuse us up here in the same way. ......In other words, the most obvious possible goal for her...isn't the real one."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………だが、俺たちのゲームでは、死者が赤でトドメを刺されちまう。…ゲーム盤の世界では誤魔化せても、ここから俯瞰する俺たちは誤魔化せない。……だから、このもっとも王道となる目的は、違うってことになる。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………だが、俺たちのゲームでは、死者が赤でトドメを刺されちまう。…ゲーム盤の世界では誤魔化せても、ここから俯瞰する俺たちは誤魔化せない。……だから、このもっとも王道となる目的は、違うってことになる」
Russian (RU): ".........Но в наших играх благодаря красному мёртвые действительно мертвы. ...Даже если она может запутывать их в мире игровой доски, здесь ей нельзя делать ничего подобного. ......То есть, наиболее очевидная возможная цель для неё... не её настоящая цель."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Porém, nos nossos jogos, os mortos foram parados graças ao vermelho. ...Ela poderia enganar todos no mundo do tabuleiro, mas esses truques não funcionam da mesma forma aqui. ......Ou seja, a proposta mais tradicional para esse tipo de assassinato...não foi o utilizado aqui."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………但是，在我們的遊戲中，死者將會被紅字給予最後一擊。…就算在棋盤世界上糊弄過去了，也沒法瞞過在此俯瞰的我們。……所以，這個最為王道的目的，並沒有說中。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………但是，在我们的游戏中，死者将会被红字给予最后一击。…就算在棋盘世界上糊弄过去了，也没法瞒过在此俯瞰的我们。……所以，这个最为王道的目的，并没有说中。」

Speaker: {f:5:Virgilia}
Umineko Project (UP): "In that case, what are the other two reasons for carrying out a nursery‐rhyme murder?"

Umineko Project (UP): {f:5:Beatrice}, the fickle witch who committed a meaningless, worthless serial murder.
Steam (ST): {f:5:Beatrice}, the fickle witch who committed a meaningless, worthless string of serial murders.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Beatrice, the fickle witch who committed a meaningless, worthless serial murder.
PC Japanese (JP): 無意味、無価値な連続殺人を犯す、気紛れな魔女、ベアトリーチェ。
Russian (RU): {f:5:Беатриче}. Непостоянная ведьма, совершающая бессмысленное и ничего не значащее серийное убийство.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {f:5:Beatrice}, a caprichosa bruxa que comete um inexpressivo assassinato em série sem valor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 犯下無意義、無價值的連續殺人，隨性亂來的魔女，貝阿朵莉切。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 犯下无意义、无价值的连续杀人，随性乱来的魔女，贝阿朵莉切。

Umineko Project (UP): Even the riddle of the epitaph, which she made into a condition to suspend the serial murders, is meaningless, immaterial.
Steam (ST): Even the epitaph's riddle, which that witch used as the trigger that could suspend the serial murders, ...is meaningless, immaterial.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even the epitaph's riddle, which that witch made into a condition to suspend the serial murders... is meaningless, immaterial.
PC Japanese (JP): その魔女が連続殺人を中止する条件とする碑文の謎も、無意味、無価値。
Russian (RU): Даже загадка эпитафии, после разгадки которой эта ведьма обещала остановить серийные убийства, бессмысленна, несущественна.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Até mesmo o enigma do epitáfio, que ela transformou em uma condição de suspender os assassinatos, é inexpressivo e infrutífero.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 作為令這位魔女停止連續殺人的條件的碑文之謎，也是沒有意義，沒有價值的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 作为令这位魔女停止连续杀人的条件的碑文之谜，也是没有意义，没有价值的。

Umineko Project (UP): And......she's thrusting this meaningless, immaterial thing in front of my face.
Steam (ST): And yet...she's thrusting this meaningless, immaterial thing in front of my face.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And, ......she's thrusting this meaningless, immaterial thing in front of my face.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、その無意味、無価値を、……俺に突き付ける。
Russian (RU): И...... она бросает эту несущественную бессмыслицу мне в лицо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E......ela estava impelindo essa coisa inexpressiva e infrutífera na minha cara.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而她，將這無意義、無價值，……亮在了我的眼前。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而她，将这无意义、无价值，……亮在了我的眼前。

Umineko Project (UP): ......What is it......that you want from me...?{n}......Or else, what is it that you want to give me......?
Steam (ST): ...What is it...that you want from me...? ...Or else, what is it that you're giving me...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......What is it......that you want from me...?......Or else, what is it that you want to give me......?
PC Japanese (JP): ……お前は、……俺に何を求めているんだ…？……あるいは、何を与えているんだ……？
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……お前は、……俺に何を求めているんだ…？{n}……あるいは、何を与えているんだ……？
Russian (RU): ......Что...... ты от меня хочешь?..{n}......Или что ты хочешь дать мне?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O que é......que você queria de mim...?{n}......Ou talvez, o que você queria transmitir para mim......?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……你，……是希望我給出點什麼呢…？{n}……又或是，給了我一些什麼呢……？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……你，……是希望我给出点什么呢…？{n}……又或是，给了我一些什么呢……？

Umineko Project (UP): My idea that Beato must have been taking revenge on me...has already been refuted in red by {f:5:Virgilia}.
Steam (ST): My idea that Beato has clearly been taking revenge on me...has already been denied by {f:5:Virgilia}'s red truth.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): My idea that Beato must have been taking revenge on me...has already been denied by Virgilia's red truth.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺がベアトに復讐されているに違いないという想像は、すでにワルギリアによって赤で否定されている。
Russian (RU): Моё предположение о том, что Беато мстит мне, уже опровергнуто красной правдой {f:5:Вергилии}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Minha ideia de que a Beato estava se vingando de mim...já foi refutada em vermelho pela {f:5:Virgilia}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我那“貝阿朵無疑是在向我復仇”的想像，已被瓦爾基莉亞以紅字否定。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我那“贝阿朵无疑是在向我复仇”的想象，已被瓦尔基莉亚以红字否定。

Umineko Project (UP): Both X and Y...{n}Both the epitaph murders and the epitaph's riddle...mean nothing to Beato.
Steam (ST): Both X and Y. Both the epitaph murders and the epitaph's riddle hold no meaning for {f:5:Beatrice}.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Both X and Y. Both the epitaph murders and the epitaph's riddle mean nothing to Beato.
PC Japanese (JP): ＸにもＹにも。碑文殺人にも碑文の謎にも、ベアトには何も意味がない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ＸにもＹにも。{n}碑文殺人にも碑文の謎にも、ベアトには何も意味がない。
Russian (RU): И Х, и Y.{n}И убийства эпитафии, и загадка эпитафии для Беато ничего не значат.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Tanto X quanto Y...{n}Tanto os assassinatos de epitáfio quanto o enigma do epitáfio...não significavam nada para a Beato.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): X 也好 Y 也好。{n}碑文殺人也好碑文之謎也好，對於貝阿朵沒有任何意義。
Chinese Simplified (CN): X 也好 Y 也好。{n}碑文杀人也好碑文之谜也好，对于贝阿朵没有任何意义。

Umineko Project (UP): However, since she's thrusting that in front of me, ...it must......have some meaning.
Steam (ST): However, since she's thrusting those things in front of me, ...they must... ...have some meaning.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, since she's thrusting that in front of me......it must......have some meaning.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、それを俺に突き付ける以上、……意味が、……きっとある。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかし、それを俺に突き付ける以上、……意味が、……きっとある。
Russian (RU): Но если она показывает мне это...... в этом должен...... быть смысл.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，既然她将此亮在了我的面前，……那就一定，……有意义。

Umineko Project (UP): She presents us a pair of scales representing "if you don't solve the epitaph, I'll carry out the epitaph murders".
Steam (ST): She showed us the scales representing "if you don't solve the epitaph, I'll carry out the epitaph murders".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She showed us the scales representing 'if you don't solve the epitaph, I'll carry out the epitaph murders'.
PC Japanese (JP): “碑文の謎が解けなければ、碑文殺人を実行する”という天秤を、俺たちに、提示する。
Russian (RU): Она показала нам весы, представляющие 'Если вы не разгадаете эпитафию, я совершу убийства эпитафии'.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela nos apresentou uma balança de dois pratos que representava "se não resolverem o epitáfio, irei conduzir os assassinatos de epitáfio".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她向我們出示了，“若不去解開碑文之謎，我就會實行碑文殺人”的天平。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她向我们出示了，“若不去解开碑文之谜，我就会实行碑文杀人”的天平。

Umineko Project (UP): Neither the epitaph murders nor the epitaph's riddle have any significance by themselves.
Steam (ST): In other words, neither the epitaph murders nor the epitaph's riddle have any significance by themselves.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, neither the epitaph murders nor the epitaph's riddle have any significance by themselves.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、碑文殺人も碑文の謎も、個々では確かに意味がない。
Russian (RU): Иначе говоря, ни убийства эпитафии, ни загадка сами по себе не имеют никакого значения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nem os assassinatos de epitáfio e nem o enigma do epitáfio tinham qualquer significado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也就是說，雖然碑文殺人也好、碑文之謎也好，分開來單獨講的確是沒有意義的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，虽然碑文杀人也好、碑文之谜也好，分开来单独讲的确是没有意义的。

Umineko Project (UP): However, it becomes meaningful when she puts both halves on the scales and thrusts it out before us.........no, before me.
Steam (ST): However, it becomes meaningful when she puts both halves on the scales and puts them on display before us......no, before me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, it becomes meaningful when she puts both halves on the scales and thrusts it out before us.........no, before me.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、天秤の両端に乗せて俺たちに、………いや、俺に突き付けることで、初めて意味が現れる。
Russian (RU): Однако они становятся значимы, когда она кладёт обе половинки на весы и суёт их нам......... нет, мне.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, passou a ter um significado quando ela colocou as duas partes na balança e impeliu diante de nós.........não, diante de mim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，通過將它們放到天平的兩端，出示給我們、………不，出示給我看，它們才首次出現了意義。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，通过将它们放到天平的两端，出示给我们、………不，出示给我看，它们才首次出现了意义。

Steam (ST): ...In other words, it should be like this:

Umineko Project (UP): A scale with meaningless, weightless things on both sides.{n}However, it has weight itself...and gives the rest meaning.
Steam (ST): A scale with meaningless, weightless things on both sides. However, it has weight itself...and gives the rest meaning.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A scale with meaningless, weightless things on both sides. However, it has weight itself...and gives the rest meaning.
PC Japanese (JP): 両端に、重みを持たぬ無意味が乗せられた天秤。しかし、それ自体が重みを伴い、意味を、成す。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 両端に、重みを持たぬ無意味が乗せられた天秤。{n}しかし、それ自体が重みを伴い、意味を、成す。
Russian (RU): Весы с бессмысленными, невесомыми с обеих сторон вещами.{n}Тем не менее, они имеют вес... и придают остальному смысл.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma balança inexpressiva, sem peso em nenhum dos lados.{n}Porém, ela própria tinha um peso...e apresentava um significado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 天平兩端，放著沒有重量的無意義之物。{n}然而，“放在兩端”本身卻有了重量，形成了意義。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "......It's almost like......playing. Like kids playing rock‐paper‐scissors."
Steam (ST): "...It's almost like...playing. Like kids playing rock, paper, scissors."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......It's almost like......playing. Like kids playing rock, paper, scissors."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……まるで、……遊びだな。子どものジャンケンみたいだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……まるで、……遊びだな。子どものジャンケンみたいだ」
Russian (RU): "......Почти как...... игра. Как когда дети играют в камень‐ножницы‐бумагу."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Como se fosse......uma brincadeira. Como crianças brincado de pedra, papel e tesoura."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……簡直就像是，……玩耍。好比是小孩子的猜拳。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……简直就像是，……玩耍。好比是小孩子的猜拳。」

Umineko Project (UP): Rock‐paper‐scissors is the most immediate method of randomly determining a winner and a loser.
Steam (ST): Rock, paper, scissors is an extremely familiar method of randomly determining a winner and loser.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rock, paper, scissors is an extremely familiar method to randomly determine a winner and a loser.
PC Japanese (JP): ジャンケンはもっとも身近な、勝敗を決めるランダム発生器だ。
Russian (RU): Камень‐ножницы‐бумага — крайне знакомый метод определения победителя и проигравшего.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Esse é o método mais imediato de determinar um vencedor e um perdedor de forma aleatória.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 猜拳是親朋好友間玩的，為了分出勝敗的亂數發生器。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 猜拳是亲朋好友间玩的，为了分出胜败的乱数发生器。

Umineko Project (UP): You usually bet some sort of privilege on the outcome, ......but kids often do rock‐paper‐scissors just to play, without betting anything in particular.
Steam (ST): You sometimes wager some sort of reward on the outcome, ...but kids often do rock, paper, scissors just to play, without betting anything in particular.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): You sometimes bet some sort of privilege on the outcome, ......but kids often do rock, paper, scissors just to play, without betting anything in particular.
PC Japanese (JP): 何かの権利を賭けて、勝負することも多いが、……子どもなどは、特に何も賭けず、ただの遊びとしてジャンケンをすることも多い。
Russian (RU): Иногда можно ставить на результат некую привилегию...... но дети часто играют в эту игру без этого.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Você normalmente aposta algum tipo de privilégio no resultado, ......mas as crianças costumam brincar por brincar, sem apostar nada de especial.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然也常有賭上什麼權利地決勝負，……但孩子們大多什麼都不賭，只是為了玩進行猜拳。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然也常有赌上什么权利地决胜负，……但孩子们大多什么都不赌，只是为了玩进行猜拳。

Umineko Project (UP): Unless you bet something, nothing but a feeling of joy or disappointment will come from a win or a loss.
Steam (ST): Unless you bet something, you have nothing to gain or lose except happiness and frustration.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Unless you bet something, you have nothing to gain or lose except happiness and frustration.
PC Japanese (JP): 何か賭けない限り、勝っても負けても、嬉しい悔しい以上の何も生まれはしない。
Russian (RU): Ни на что не поставив, ничего не приобретёшь и не потеряешь, кроме счастья или разочарования.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A não ser que aposte algo, nada mais além de um sentimento de alegria ou desapontamento virá de uma vitória ou derrota.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 既然什麼都不賭，那不論勝敗，都不會產生除去高興、懊悔外的其他東西。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 既然什么都不赌，那不论胜败，都不会产生除去高兴、懊悔外的其他东西。

Umineko Project (UP): In other words, the two sides of the scale, winning and losing, are both valueless.
Steam (ST): In other words, the two sides of the scale, both winning and losing, are immaterial.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, the two sides of the scale, both winning and losing, are immaterial.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、勝つことも負けることも、天秤の両端は無価値。
Russian (RU): То есть, обе стороны весов — победа и поражение — несущественны.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ou seja, os dois lados da balança, a vitória e a derrota, ambos não possuem valor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 換句話說，勝利也好敗北也罷，天平的兩端沒有價值。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 换句话说，胜利也好败北也罢，天平的两端没有价值。

Umineko Project (UP): However, the very act of seeing which way it will tip...is the reason kids play rock‐paper‐scissors.
Steam (ST): However, the very act of seeing which way it will tip... is the reason kids play rock, paper, scissors.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, the very act of seeing which way it will tip... is the reason kids play rock, paper, scissors.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、そのどちらに傾くかという、その行為そのものが、子どもたちがジャンケンで遊ぶ目的となっている。
Russian (RU): Однако само наблюдение за тем, как всё обернётся, и есть та причина, по которой дети играют в камень‐ножницы‐бумагу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, o simples ato de ver no que vai dar...é a razão pela qual as crianças brincam.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而，看天平會傾向哪一方的，這個行為本身，就成了孩子們玩猜拳的目的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，看天平会倾向哪一方的，这个行为本身，就成了孩子们玩猜拳的目的。

Umineko Project (UP): After all, the kids are enjoying the communication that surrounds the game, ......and they aren't purely interested in the value of winning or losing.
Steam (ST): After all, the kids are enjoying the communication that surrounds the game, ...and they aren't purely interested in the value of winning or losing.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After all, the kids are enjoying the communication that surrounds the game, ......and they aren't purely interested in the value of winning or losing.
PC Japanese (JP): だから子どもは、ジャンケンを巡ってのコミュニケーションを楽しんでいるのであり、……勝敗に純粋な価値を求めているわけではない。
Russian (RU): Ведь они наслаждаются игрой...... и не особо заинтересованы в ценности победы или поражения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No fim, as crianças estão aproveitando a comunicação que envolve o jogo, ......e não estão realmente interessadas no valor da vitória ou da derrota.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，孩子們是在以以猜拳為中心的溝通交流為樂，……並沒有對勝敗謀求其純粹的價值。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，孩子们是在以以猜拳为中心的沟通交流为乐，……并没有对胜败谋求其纯粹的价值。

Umineko Project (UP): They aren't overly concerned about who wins and who loses......
Steam (ST): They aren't overly concerned about who wins and who loses...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They aren't overly concerned about who wins and who loses......
PC Japanese (JP): 勝敗に、固執してはいないのだ……。
Russian (RU): Они не слишком озабочены тем, кто выиграет, а кто проиграет......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Elas não estão preocupadas com quem ganha ou quem perde......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對勝敗，沒有執著……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对胜败，没有执着……。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "That would mean that it doesn't matter to Beato......whether the epitaph murders succeed or not. ......It almost feels like she's just enjoying the process."

Russian (RU): "Значит, для Беато не имеет значения...... пройдут ли убийства эпитафии успешно. ......Выглядит так, будто она просто наслаждается процессом."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O que significa que não importava para a Beato......se os assassinatos de epitáfio seriam bem‐sucedidos ou não. ......É quase como se ela simplesmente estivesse se divertindo com os acontecimentos."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那麼，對貝阿朵來說的碑文殺人，……就成了一個，成不成功都無所謂的東西。……甚至令人感覺，她是在純粹地享受這個過程。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那么，对贝阿朵来说的碑文杀人，……就成了一个，成不成功都无所谓的东西。……甚至令人感觉，她是在纯粹地享受这个过程。」

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……以前の俺なら、…無意味な殺人を繰り返す非道な魔女だと決め付け、こいつを罵っただろうさ。……だが、今の俺にはそうとは思えない」
